course_main_structural_unit.address:
Narva mnt 18
51009 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The course gives an overview of the following methods in multivariate statistical analysis: principal component analysis, canonical correlation analysis, discriminant analysis, cluster analysis, multidimensional scaling, factor analysis and independent component analysis. In computer classes the studied methods are applied to real and simulated data.
description.et: Kursuses antakse ülevaade järgmistest mitmemõõtmelise statistilise analüüsi meetoditest: peakomponentide analüüs, kanooniline korrelatsioonanalüüs, diskriminantanalüüs, klasteranalüüs, mitmemõõtmeline skaleerimine ja faktoranalüüs. Arvutipraktikumides rakendatakse käsitletud  meetodeid reaalsetele ja simuleeritud andmetele.

objectives.en: To give an overview of some main methods in multivariate statistical analysis and their application  using statistical software.
objectives.et: Esitada üliõpilastele ülevaade põhilistest mitmemõõtmelise statistilise analüüsi meetoditest ja nende rakendamisest arvutitarkvara  abil.

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course a student
- shall have knowledge of the multivariate analysis methods handled during the course;
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb kursuse jooksul käsitletud mitmemõõtmelise analüüsi meetodeid;

learning_outcomes.en: - understands and can explain main ideas of the studied methods;
learning_outcomes.et: - on aru saanud ja oskab selgitada ideesid, millel vaadeldud meetodid põhinevad;

learning_outcomes.en: - shall be able to apply the studied methods appropriately to multivariate data sets using computer software and interpret the results of statistical analysis.
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab õpitud meetodeid sobivalt arvutitarkvara abil mitmemõõtmelistele andmetele rakendada  ja oskab statistilise analüüsi tulemusi tõlgendada.

description.et: Maximum is 10 points, for a positive result at least 5 points is required.
Two homework assignments are distributed during the course. At least 50% of the points from each home work are needed in order to qualify for the final examination. Maximum is alltogether 10 points.
Maximum is 10 points, for a positive result at least 5 points is required.

grade_preconditions.et: Attendance at computer classes (at least 60%). Approved home assignments.

grade_evaluation.et: The final score is calculated as follows: 0.2test + 0.2home assignments + 0.6exam work

debt_elimination.et: In case of a failure, the test and home assignments can be redone only once during the semester, the same holds for the exam.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.recommended_materials:
Izenman, A. Modern Multivariate Statistical Techniques. Springer, 2008.

Rencher, A., Christensen, W. Methods of Multivariate Analysis. Wiley, 2012.

Härdle, W., Simar, L. Applied Multivariate Statistical Analysis. Springer, 2015.

Hastie, T., Tibshirani, R., Friedman, J. The Elements of Statistical Learning. Springer, 2013.

description.et: Lecture 1. Introduction to multivariate statistical methods
Lecture 2 - Lecture 6. Linear dimensionality reduction methods: principal component analysis, canonical correlation analysis, factor analysis

audience.et: Compulsory prerequisite: a basic course in probability theory and statistics
